title: Bluestone 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Shenandoah Valley)
description: The nose of this wine is soft and toasty, with notes of sweet cream and butter. The creamy mouthfeel offers bursts of buttered popcorn, pineapple and toasted Challah. It's a nice choice if you like a round, buttery Chardonnay. The flavors, however, don't linger on the finish and instead turn slightly bitter.

title: Carneros Ranch 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is an earthy, minty, tart and taut wine, worthy of its appellation. It offers light-bodied notions of black tea, cranberry and rhubarb.

title: Rascal 2014 Pinot Gris (America)
description: Light aromas of freshly cut, slightly oxidized red apple lead to medium- to full-bodied fruit flavors. It goes down easy.

title: New Kent 2015 Vidal Blanc (Virginia)
description: Soft and delicate aromas of peach, quince, apricot and violet lead to a lively palate of honeysuckle and lemonade alongside more peach and violet. The finish is long and sweet in ripe fruit flavors.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2014 Les Natures Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A strangely tart notion persists on the nose. The palate rings with the same strange but faintly red-currant-like aroma. The body is light, fresh and dry and has a clean finish. Drink soon.

title: Le Bertille 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: French oak, coconut and spiced plum aromas carry over to the palate, where sour cherry fruit is accented by oak spice and sage. It's lean and austere, with a raspy finish.

title: Melrose 2013 Baco Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: Dark, tannic and earthy, this pure varietal wine brings up flavors somewhat akin to Washington's Lemberger. The sour-cherry fruit is wrapped in broad flavors of forest floor and wet leaves. There's a bit of a hole in the middle, which might be nicely filled with a good hamburger.

title: Golden 2013 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino)
description: This big and imposing wine pushes the boundaries with assertive charcoal and smoked meat aromas, tons of tannin and an oaky, astringent finish. Best to drink after 2022, by which time the mouthfeel may have mellowed.

title: E16 2014 Trenton 1880 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the Martaella Vineyard, this wine shows pretty cola spice and earth, remaining subtle and light in the glass. Rounded tannins provide a supple mouthfeel, with additional elements of toasted oak and cherry-vanilla.

title: Nottola 2014  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Unusual hay, fennel and weedy underbrush aromas lead the nose. The palate is lean and brisk, offering raw cherry, chopped herb and star anise alongside flavors, framed by tightly knit tannins.

title: Nugan Family Estates 2014 Third Generation Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
description: Cinnamon, clove and cashew notes combine with peach and pineapple to offer a fleshy mouthful of satisfying flavor that only lacks a bit of zest on the finish. Drink now.

title: Original House Wine 2014 Mountain Merlot (America)
description: Light aromas of raspberry and berry lead to medium-bodied flavors. The tannins bring a touch of astringency that's offset by the sweetness of the red- and blue-fruit flavors.

title: Fattoria Fibbiano 2014 Casalini  (Chianti Superiore)
description: This blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Ciliegiolo has dark-skinned fruit and underbrush aromas. Black cherry jam brightened by a hint of green tea is the core flavor, set against a backdrop of easygoing tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Pellet Estate 2015 Pellet Vineyard CabRosé Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: This estate wine is made from free-run Cabernet Sauvignon juice and tastes of cranberry and dried herbs. It's concentrated, full-bodied and intense.

title: Nottola 2011 Il Fattore Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This opens with weedy underbrush, prune, sage and game aromas. The palate seems evolved, offering dried cherry and cranberry notes with a grainy tannic structure.

title: Prophecy 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine is fruity, ripe and almost sweet, making it approachable for new wine drinkers and a good option for a large party. The texture is soft, the mouthfeel warm and the flavors candy-like.

title: Michael Sullberg 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This traditionally-styled wine has nice olive and herb aromas and smoky, dark cherry and bell pepper flavors. It's light-bodied, smooth and easy to sip.

title: Gregory Graham 2014 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Deep gold in color, this vineyard designate is oaky, with gingerbread, caramel and canned pineapple flavors. It's full, unctuous and creamy on the palate.

title: Salomon Estate 2013 Finniss River Sea Eagle Vineyard Shiraz (Fleurieu Peninsula)
description: This is dark and earthy, featuring notes suggestive of prune and dark chocolate. It's full-bodied and creamy in texture, but a bit warm on the supple finish.

title: Louloute 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Just barely out of barrel when released, this will surely benefit from another year or so in bottle. The watermelon and strawberry fruit is pretty and light, and the acids have a peachy tang, but the mouthfeel is not yet quite integrated.

title: Sidewood 2015 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)
description: Pear, melon and citrus notes mark this plump, medium-bodied wine. There's a bit of copper hue to the wine's color, and while the finish is long, it also carries a hint of bitterness.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary White (Valencia)
description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo opens with aromas of bath soap and apple juice. Plump and standard in feel, this tastes of stone fruits and salt. On the finish, which is steady but basic, this tastes bready and leesy.

title: Villa San Juliette 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Graphite, tar, pine and smoldering campfire aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which only shows brief flashes of the grape's peppery, herbal core. There are forest floor hints on the palate, where dried mulberry flavors meet with pine and cracked pepper notes.

title: Three Thieves 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Light floral and green apple aromas and ripe apple and peach flavors make this wine tasty and easy to like. It's medium-bodied and soft on the finish.

title: Vinum 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Dried and cooked plum and mulberry aromoas meet with dried ginger and licorice on the nose of this bottling. That hearty fruit splashes all over the palate, evoking plum pudding, anise spice and more stewed fruit flavors.

title: Frank Family 2014 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Smoky oak and campfire scents provide an earthy entry into this densely tannic wine. Upfront in its youthful power, black fruit and assertive oak flavors muddle its varietal character.

title: EOS 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Butterscotch, tangerine and honeysuckle show on the nose of this bottling. There is a bit of textural tension to the sip, with buttery hazelnut and seared apple flavors. Familiar if simple.

title: Fattoria Il Muro 2015  Chianti
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with subdued black-skinned fruit and underbrush aromas. It's built for early drinking and delivers ripe plum and cinnamon flavors with supple tannins.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2014 Rust Rock Vineyard Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This full-bodied and robust wine is marked by dense tannins and heavy-handed oak, suppressing its ripe, bold strawberry and rhubarb flavors. The acidity is moderate and as of yet not fully integrated.

title: Circe 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: After opening with white fruit and mineral aromas, this shows a sticky palate made fatter by low acidity. Candied sugary mango, banana and melon flavors are distinctly sweet, which could be a plus or minus depending on your tolerance for residual sugar in a white wine.
